ratings.comment: Peggy is just nice. Always lenient and kind, but gives good constructive feedback. You must go to class if you want to succeed. She is always willing to help.

I wish she was my grandma. She brings food to class and made us little heart waffles once. Lenient grader and easy exams so long as you try. Finished 101 and 102 with a 99%. But if you don't try it will catch up to you and you won't recover. Just do the homework and show up to class. It's that easy.

Peggy is honestly the nicest woman in existence. I've never wanted to do well in a class more than I did while in her class. I wish I could continue on with Norwegian due to how fun this semester was. If you're thinking about taking a language I will highly recommend Norwegian.
Peggy makes this class simple and fun, genuinely one of the only classes I looked forward to going to every week.

Super fun class and Peggy is a great teacher. She is always very helpful and made the class interesting. Definitely want to continue taking Norwegian with her. You'll also probably get a chance to eat Norwegian waffles with jam!

One of the best professors I have ever had. She makes class super engaging and really cares about your progress. She genuinely just wants to help you learn and enjoy the material. Definitely recommend taking

Peggy is not only one of the most organized and prepared professors I have had at UW, but also one of the nicest. I have taken multiple classes with her and she's definitely my favorite. Great teacher and very fair grading -- if you're not doing well, it's not because of her teaching.

Peggy is easily one of my favorite professors at UW. It's obvious she cares about her students, both in and out of the classroom. She's very clear with Norwegian grammar concepts and is always willing to help you out if you don't understand something. She makes her students want to learn Norwegian. Take her if you can!

Peggy is easily one of my favorite professors that I have ever had. She is so helpful whenever you need it, and you can tell that she is very passionate about Norwegian, and she wants you to have that passion as well. I went into this class just needing it for a language requirement and have now decided to continue with it until I graduate!

This class is a good option for anyone who needs to fulfill a foreign language requirement! Norwegian is a relatively simple lecture, and Peggy makes all of the grammatical rules/language use VERY clear. She also knows a lot of cool stuff about Norway that is surprisingly interesting! Easy A if you actually study for quizzes/tests!
Peggy is one of my favorite professors in Madison. She is extremely helpful and clear in her lectures.  I strongly recommend this class to anybody willing to learn Norwegian.

Peggy is easily the best lecturer I have had at UW. The classes are often very small which allows you to really learn the language. It is obvious that Peggy really cares about her students and wants them to do well. Definitely a class where an A is possible if you do the work and show up to class. I highly recommend this class!

Peggy is a very good teacher for Norwegian 101. She always tries to make things fun, and the workload isn't TOO bad, though since the class is every day there is daily homework. She really loves what she does, and she's always willing to help you out. Definitely recommend!
Peggy is an absolutely wonderful teacher.  Her presentations are always engaging and fun, and she's always enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the content.

Peggy is like a mom away from mom!  She kicked off the year in Norsk 201 by inviting us to her house to have dinner, which made everyone feel welcome and enthusiastic.  She always has something sarcastic or funny to say.  I'm just sorry I can't have her for Scandinavian studies for the rest of college.

Very, very good teacher. She loves the Norwegian culture and ways of life, which makes the class fun and interesting. Use the book everyday. Quizzes easy, but make sure you study for the tests, especially with phrases and questions. Dialogues are written. Overall, gets her point across and has a passion for teaching.
Peggy is everything a teacher should be- informative, helpful, understanding, and flexible.  Always looking out for your best interest as a student and a person.  The best.
Wonderful.  Peggy is the best.  She makes you always feel comfortable and is very understanding.  I learned Norwegian with ease due to her excellent teaching methods.
No Comments
Peggy is great.
Really an easy class.  The language is not hard, and Peggy is really nice.  Quizzes are very easy and the exams are straightforward.
